articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Reply Message to Syrian President
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Reply Message to Syrian President

					Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, sent a reply message to Bashar Al-Assad, president of Syria who doubles as regional secretary of the Arab Baath Socialist Party, on Wednesday.
					
					The message said:
					
					I express thanks to you for sending a message of sympathy in connection with the floods that hit some parts of the DPRK, causing damage.
					
					Availing myself of this opportunity, I express belief that the good relations of friendship and cooperation between our two countries would grow stronger.

articles.title: Congratulations to Cypriot FM
articles.content:
Congratulations to Cypriot FM

					Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- DPRK Minister of Foreign Affairs Pak Ui Chun Tuesday sent a congratulatory message to Erato Kozakou Marcoullis on her appointment as minister of Foreign Affairs of Cyprus.
					
					He expressed the belief that the bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation would continue to develop favorably and wished the Cypriot foreign minister success in her work.

articles.title: Greetings to Syrian FM
articles.content:
Greetings to Syrian FM

					Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a message of greeting to Walid Al-Muallem, minister of Foreign Affairs and Expatriates, on the 45th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the DPRK and Syria.
					
					The message said that the two countries have boosted the ties of friendship, supporting and closely cooperating with each other in various fields after the establishment of diplomatic ties and expressed the belief that the excellent relations of friendship and cooperation with a long history and tradition would continue to vigorously develop.

articles.title: Foreign Guests and Overseas Koreans Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Foreign Guests and Overseas Koreans Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung

					Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- Foreign guests and overseas Koreans visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace on Thursday to pay tribute to President Kim Il Sung.
					
					They included the Defence Ministry delegation of Vietnam headed by Deputy Minister Lieut. General Nguyen Chi Vinh and the delegation of the educational officials of the General Association of Koreans Residents in Japan (Chongryon) led by O Haeng Dok, section chief of the Education Department of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon.
					
					They made entries in the visitor's book.
					
					The head of the Vietnamese delegation wrote in the book:
					
					Kim Il Sung and President Ho Chi Minh provided the traditional relations of friendship between the two countries. I am convinced that the army and the people of the DPRK will achieve the cause of building a thriving nation as desired by Kim Il Sung under the wise leadership of Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: DPRK Women Shooters Prove Successful in Military Games
articles.content:
DPRK Women Shooters Prove Successful in Military Games

					Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- DPRK girls won the 25m sports pistol and 25m rapid-fire pistol team events of the 5th World Military Games held in Brazil in July.
					
					Some 40 shooters from more than ten countries competed in shooting matches.
					
					The DPRK girls scored 848 points in the 25m sports pistol event held on the 19th to defeat Polish, Brazilian, Norwegian and Indian rivals and take the title.
					
					In the 25m rapid-fire pistol event held on the 22nd they trounced Chinese, Polish, Norwegian and Brazilian shooters and finished first with 1 725 points.
					
					They are Ri Hyang Sun, 26, Kim Hyang Gum, 22 and So Un Ju, 22. All of them belong to the April 25 National Defense Sports Team.
					
					Ri won gold medals at the 10m air pistol event of the 10th Asian Shooting Championship in 2004 and the 25m rapid-fire pistol team event of the 4th World Military Games in 2007.

articles.title: Ministries and National Institutions Render Help in Construction of Huichon Power Station
articles.content:
Ministries and National Institutions Render Help in Construction of Huichon Power Station

					Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- Ministries and national institutions are rendering sincere help in the construction of the Huichon Power Station.
					
					Officials and employees of the Ministry of Agriculture, the Ministry of Oil Industry and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs visited builders, bringing with them tools, daily necessities and others, encouraging them.
					
					Material and moral support was rendered to the builders there by the Ministry of Construction and Building Materials Industry, the Ministry of Mining Industry, the State Commission for Quality Management, the Sericulture and Silk Fabrics Guidance Bureau, the Central Statistic Bureau, the Publication Guidance Bureau, the Mansudae Art Studio and other ministries and national institutions.
					
					Officials of the Central Committee of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea visited the construction site several times in the first half of the year. They handed aid materials to soldier-builders and conducted frontline-style agitation, arousing them to perform fresh feats.
					
					Meanwhile, workers in the field of railway transport including the Pyongyang, Kaechon, Rason and Chongjin railway bureaus and employees of Chongryu Restaurant, the Kwangbok Department Store, the Aeguk Moran Garment Factory and many other units distinguished themselves in helping the builders there.

articles.title: DPRK's Environmental Law Supplemented with New Articles
articles.content:
DPRK's Environmental Law Supplemented with New Articles

					Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Law on the Protection of Environment was recently supplemented with some articles in two chapters.
					
					Articles 38, 39 and 40, which stipulate the development and use of renewable energy, the establishment of an environmental authentication system and the introduction of technologies of recycling resources, were added to Chapter 3 "Prevention of Environmental Pollution". Articles 44 and 48, regulating the planning of environmental economy indexes and the supervision over environmental condition, were annexed to Chapter 4 "Supervision over Environmental Protection".
					
					The new articles are aimed to encourage the country's industrial establishments and agencies to reduce the consumption of fossil energy like coal and crude oil and develop and utilize renewable energy such as solar, wind and geothermal power in order to protect environment and ensure a stable economic growth.
					
					They are also aimed to base production and management activities on a proper environmental conservation system and increase the utility rate of recycled resources.

articles.title: June 2 Camping of Schoolchildren from across Country Starts
articles.content:
June 2 Camping of Schoolchildren from across Country Starts

					Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- The June 2 camping of schoolchildren from across the country began.
					
					This camping is organized every year for members of the Children's Union of secondary schools in various parts of the country who set examples in study and its organizational life in accordance with the proposal made by leader Kim Jong Il on June 2, Juche 45 (1956) to let all schoolchildren across the country conduct brisk camping activities during summer vacation.
					
					A ceremony was held at the Mangyongdae Children's Camp in Mt. Ryongak Thursday. 
					
					Ham Kwang Chol, secretary of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, made a report to be followed by speeches.
					
					A reporter and speakers called on the campers to deeply grasp the revolutionary feats performed by the members of Mangyongdae family and consolidate what they learned at schools and train their bodies and minds through diverse activities including mountaineering, presentation of what they wrote after reading, plant collecting, etc.
					
					A flag of the June 2 camping was awarded to the campers.

articles.title: 6th National Exhibition of University Scientific Research Successes Opens
articles.content:
6th National Exhibition of University Scientific Research Successes Opens

					Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- The 6th national exhibition of university scientific research successes was opened with due ceremony at the Three-Revolution Exhibition on Thursday.
					
					On display at the exhibition are more than 1 900 valuable data achieved by teachers and researchers of at least 90 universities here and local areas.
					
					The exhibition is divided into over 20 panels including light industry, agriculture, metal industry, power industry, railway transport, machine building, electronics and automation and medical science. They will offer opportunities of introducing and exchanging the successes made in solving scientific and technological issues arising in practice in recent years.
					
					Present at the opening ceremony were Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, university presidents and rectors, officials concerned and others.

articles.title: Angling Contest Held in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Angling Contest Held in Pyongyang

					Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- The 10th Pyongyang angling contest was held on Taedong River Thursday.
					
					Standings depend on the number of fishes hooked in a fixed time with an angler allowed to use four angling tools to the maximum.
					
					A worker of the Kim Jong Suk Pyongyang Silk Mill, Hong Je Hwan (55), placed the first in the contest attended by some 40 anglers. He caught the first fish in a minute and then more than 10 fishes.
					
					Among the first three finishers are Kim Yong Hwan (65) residing in Sosong District and Kim Tae Jip (70) in Mangyongdae District.
					
					The vice-chairman of the Pyongyang Municipal Committee of the Nature Conservation Union of Korea, Jo Kwang Bok (58), told KCNA that the contest gave a glimpse of the Korean people's cultural life developing under the policy of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					The annual event has ever grown in scale, drawing increasing public interest, he said.

articles.title: Songbul Temple in Mt. Jongbang
articles.content:
Songbul Temple in Mt. Jongbang

					Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- The Jongbangsan Recreation Ground in Sariwon City, North Hwanghae Province, the DPRK has the Songbul Temple, one of the cultural relics associated with the Korean people's talents and wisdom. 
					
					The temple is located at the foot of Chonsong Peak, the highest peak of Mt. Jongbang. It is known that the temple was built in 898 and rebuilt in the period of Koryo, an ancient state of Korea (918-1392).
					
					The temple includes six buildings -- Kukrak, Ungjin and Myongbu halls, Chongphung and Sansin pavilions and Unha Shrine -- and a five-storey stone pagoda.
					
					The Kukrak Hall, rebuilt in 1376, is a one-storey building with a gabled roof.
					
					The Ungjin Hall was reconstructed in 1327.
					
					The pagoda is standing in front of the Kukrak Hall.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Terms Ulji Freedom Guardian Unjustifiable
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Terms Ulji Freedom Guardian Unjustifiable

					Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- The Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises are criminal acts to do harm to the DPRK by force of arms under the guise of dialogue as they are a product of the U.S. and the south Korean authorities' invariable ambition to invade it.  Rodong Sinmun Thursday says this in a bylined commentary.
					
					It goes on:
					
					The south Korean warmongers tried hard to cover up the aggressive nature of these war maneuvers, claiming that they are "annual" and aim to "cope with threat." This, however, can never be justified.
					
					As it was proved by the puppet forces' recent shelling in the area of Yonphyong Island, the military threat to the Korean Peninsula is coming to the north from the south.
					
					It is reported that a U.S.-south Korea task force to be formed by the puppet military would stage exercises simulating operations and actual battles for "detecting and destroying the north's WMDs" in case of someone's "contingency."
					
					Administrative bodies will reportedly be involved in these exercises to conduct "operations to stabilize the north and transfer power to civilians." This tells that the on-going UFG is drills for an actual war to seize the north and realize the ambition to "unify systems".
					
					The south Korean authorities are stepping up the war preparations to do harm to the north by force of arms under the signboard of dialogue.
					
					With no rhetoric can they hide the criminal nature of this saber-rattling threatening the peace of the country and pushing the situation in the Korean Peninsula to a catastrophe.

articles.title: U.S.-S. Korea Joint Military Exercises Denounced by British Organization
articles.content:
U.S.-S. Korea Joint Military Exercises Denounced by British Organization

					Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- The British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association issued a statement on August 10 denouncing the U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises.
					
					If the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces truly want dialogue and negotiations with the DPRK, they should stop at once Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises, the statement said, and went on:
					
					The joint military exercises involving huge armed forces are provocative exercises for a war of aggression as they mean a denial of dialogue with the DPRK.
					
					They are not only a threat to the sovereignty of the DPRK but a grave challenge to the peace in Asia and the rest of the world.
					
					Unpardonable are these military maneuvers as they are aimed at invading the DPRK by force of arms and undermining its socialist system.
					
					We strongly demand the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces stop at once Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises and all the provocations against the DPRK.

articles.title: August 15 Meeting for Independent Reunification Held in Seoul
articles.content:
August 15 Meeting for Independent Reunification Held in Seoul

					Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- The August 15 meeting for independent reunification was held in Seoul on August 15. It was co-sponsored by the Solidarity for Progress, the preparatory committee for the Meeting of People for Building New Society, the Democratic Labor Party and other civic and public organizations and political parties of south Korea.
					
					It was attended by more than 10 000 people from all walks of life.
					
					At the meeting speakers said they were holding the August 15 meeting for independent reunification despite the vicious obstructions of the authorities. How can people expect the authorities to work for peaceful reunification as they are crying out for "elimination of pro-north leftist forces" quite contrary to the desire of the people for reunification, they queried.
					
					Now is the time for the people to pool their strength, they said, calling for pooling the resolution of the people to oust the present regime and ushering in the era of independent and peaceful reunification.
					
					An appeal was read out at the rally. It condemned the authorities for still clinging to the policy of confrontation with fellow countrymen.
					
					If the authorities persistently deny peace and keep to the road of confrontation with the north, the people should turn out in a protest action across south Korea and once again demonstrate their will, the appeal said.
					
					They will fight on to get the authorities roll back the policy of confrontation with the DPRK and protect peace, it noted.
					
					The fascist police encircled the venue of the meeting with police buses, shouting "Disperse!" They ran riot, firing water guns at the masses.

articles.title: Release of Detained Students and Solution to Registration Fee Issue Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Release of Detained Students and Solution to Registration Fee Issue Called for in S. Korea

					Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Federation of University Students in the 21st Century held a candlelight rally in Seoul on August 13 demanding the release of the detained students and the solution to the registration fee issue.
					
					At the rally speakers expressed irrepressible resentment at the police for walking off dozens of students including Pak Ja Un, chairperson of the Federation, who were staging a demonstration outside the "National Assembly" on August 12. They urged the authorities to set free the detainees and immediately settle the registration fee issue.
					
					There is no future for students unless the present regime and the "Grand National Party" are judged, they declared.
					
					The students will take the lead in the action to judge the group of traitors without fail, braving any suppression, and carry on their dynamic actions to build a society free from worries about registration fee, their dream, they stressed.
					
					At the end of the rally, the participants staged a demonstration.

articles.title: S. Korean Chief Prosecutor Accused of Its Sinister Intention to Tide over Crisis
articles.content:
S. Korean Chief Prosecutor Accused of Its Sinister Intention to Tide over Crisis

					Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- The Democratic Labor Party and the Democratic Party of south Korea, opposition parties, laid bare the sinister aim sought by Chief Prosecutor Han Sang Dae in "declaring a war against pro-north leftist forces", according to south Korean CBS.
					
					On August 12 Han in an inaugural speech singled out "pro-north leftist forces" as one of the three targets of "the war declared by him," blustering one should never shun or step back from this fight against them.
					
					The opposition parties denounced his remarks as another coloring campaign going against the trend of the times. The present "government" is trying to tide over a serious crisis in the closing period of its rule by dint of security power, they charged.
					
					The opposition parties accused the authorities of putting forward the prosecution as a shock brigade to stay in power.
					
					The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification in a commentary on August 13 warned that his wild dream can never come true and he will certainly face a stern judgment by history and the people.

articles.title: Stop to Construction of Jeju Naval Base Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Stop to Construction of Jeju Naval Base Demanded in S. Korea

					Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- The Headquarters for Checking the Jeju Naval Base and Promoting the Jeju Participation in the August 15 Meeting for Independent Reunification of south Korea held a press conference on Jeju Island on August 14 demanding a stop to the construction of the military base.
					
					The organization accused the military authorities of pushing forward the construction of the naval base under the pretext of the "work in pursuance of the state policy" and thereby bringing misfortune to Jeju Island.
					
					The appearance of the naval base on Jeju Island would not only destroy natural environment but get the island involved in the U.S. moves for military hegemony, the organization warned.

articles.title: S. Korean Opposition Leader Assaulted
articles.content:
S. Korean Opposition Leader Assaulted

					Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- A south Korean opposition leader was assaulted by a conservative on Monday during a meeting for halving tuition fees, said the south Korean newspaper Hangyore. 
					
					When Jong Tong Yong, executive chairman of the Democratic Party, was in the meeting held in Chonggye Plaza in Seoul, a man affiliated with a conservative organization, flung himself on Jong and shook him by the hair, calling him a "red" and "pro-northern".
					
					Earlier on August 1, conservative ruffians hurled water bottles to Jong when he was inspiring labor activities with a hunger strike for a solution to the Hanjin Heavy Industry's serious situation.
					
					Next day the ruffians blocked Paek Ki Wan, director of the Unification Study Center, in his way to the hunger-strike site and threatened his life. 
					
					A spokesperson for the Democratic Party released a commentary urging the "government" to apologize for the outrages and take measures to prevent recurrence of violence.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Posted on Internet Homepages of Finnish Organizations
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Posted on Internet Homepages of Finnish Organizations

					Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- The Finnish Mangyongdae Committee for Commemorating the Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung and the Finnish National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea jointly posted on Internet homepage on Monday the full text of his work "Let Us Intensify the Anti-Imperialist, Anti-U.S. Struggle".
					
					This work, published on August 12, Juche 56 (1967), clarifies the idea that the struggle of the people of the three continents against imperialism and colonialism constitutes two major revolutionary forces of our times along with the revolutionary struggle of the international working class for socialism, the main strategy of the world revolution on concentrating attack on U.S. imperialism and ways for doing so.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Marked by Peruvian Organization
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Marked by Peruvian Organization

					Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Suk Library in Peru on August 8 published a bulletin on the 66th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					
					The bulletin carried an article illustrated with a portrait of smiling President Kim Il Sung.
					
					The article said:
					
					Korea was overcome with the joy at liberation in August of 1945.
					
					General Kim Il Sung, legendary hero of the anti-Japanese war, made a deep insight into the situation inside and outside Korea and, on this basis, indicated the way for liberated Korea to follow.
					
					It was the hope of the Korean people to build a new society on their land.
					
					How to lay down a correct line for building a new country presented itself as a vital issue for all Koreans.
					
					Kim Il Sung made a speech "On Building the Party, State and Armed Forces in the Liberated Homeland" on August 20, 1945.
					
					This speech became a beacon which indicated the road to be followed by the Korean people.
					
					He founded the Democratic People's Republic of Korea and turned it into a rich and powerful independent and sovereign state.
					
					He eliminated the reactionaries and formed the democratic national united front, laying a solid foundation for building a democratic and independent state.

articles.title: DPRK Praised by Regional Organization
articles.content:
DPRK Praised by Regional Organization

					Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- The International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions on August 11 posted on its Internet homepage an article praising the DPRK.
					
					Social and class contradictions are getting serious in the capitalist countries day by day, the article said, and went on:
					
					Such tragedies as those taking place in the capitalist countries can hardly be found in socialist Korea of Juche.
					
					Young people are playing the role as vanguard and shock brigade in socialist construction in the DPRK.
					
					The DPRK is the most stable country in the world free from any social inequality.
					
					It takes the man-centered Juche idea as the guiding idea and all its people are united as one around leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					This is something unimaginable in the capitalist countries.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Marked in Democratic Congo, Cambodia
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Marked in Democratic Congo, Cambodia

					Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- A paper of Democratic Congo and a radio of Cambodia released reports on the 66th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					
					The paper of Democratic Congo L'Avenir on August 11 carried an article with a photo of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					It said that the President organized and led the bloody anti-Japanese armed struggle to victory, achieving the historic cause of Korea's liberation.
					
					The President, who achieved the liberation of Korea by making long journeys of bloody battles against the Japanese imperialists, wisely led the country and the people for nearly half a century, it stressed.
					
					FM 90.5 Radio of Cambodia said in a program on August 9:
					
					The President led the anti-Japanese armed struggle to victory, holding high the banner of the Juche idea and the banner of independence under the most difficult conditions without state backing and support from a regular army, thus liberating Korea on August 15, 1945. 
					
					The liberation of the country paved a wide avenue for the Korean people to make its development and, as a result, the DPRK has turned into a socialist power, independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defence.

articles.title: World University Rectors' Forum Held in China
articles.content:
World University Rectors' Forum Held in China

					Beijing, August 17 (KCNA) -- A world university rectors' forum was held in Shenzhen City, China on August 13 and 14. 
					
					The forum, held on the theme "Universities' new mission in the 21st century and training of able persons ", was attended by 163 rectors from 68 nations and regions, including the president of Kim Chaek University of Technology of the DPRK. 
					
					They discussed training able persons at higher educational institutions and improving students' ability.

articles.title: U.S. Attitude Is Most Crucial: Chinese Daily
articles.content:
U.S. Attitude Is Most Crucial: Chinese Daily

					Beijing, August 17 (KCNA) -- The Chinese Defense Daily Tuesday carried an article titled "Untimely Military Exercise".
					
					The United States and south Korea term their joint military exercise "Ulji Freedom Guardian" an annual event, but the DPRK cannot but consider it a provocation, with the drill apparently aimed at the country and its offensive nature getting pronounced, said the article.
					
					The situation of the Korean peninsula is inclining towards relaxation thanks to joint efforts of parties concerned and DPRK-U.S. talks were held recently, the article noted, adding:
					
					But the exercise chills the atmosphere of relaxation, making it difficult to resume the six-party talks and solve the denuclearization of the Korean peninsula in a peaceful way.
					
					With the end of the cold war, the world's bipolar structure collapsed, but the cold war persists in the Korean peninsula.
					
					Minor conflicts have occurred one after another in the peninsula since 2002. With the security system remaining very frail, even a trifle case in the region may lead to another conflict.
					
					What is most crucial is the U.S. attitude. If the United States signs a peace agreement with the DPRK, breaking with the cold-war thinking pattern, a gleam of peace will come to the Korean peninsula.

articles.title: U.S., S.Korean Military Drill Not Helpful to Regional Peace: Xinhua
articles.content:
U.S., S. Korean Military Drill Not Helpful to Regional Peace: Xinhua

					Beijing, August 17 (KCNA) -- Xinhua on Aug. 16 dealt with the injustice of the Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises kicked off by the U.S. and the south Korean war-like forces.
					
					It said that joint military drills - code named Ulji Freedom Guardian - conducted by the United States and South Korea would by no means promote regional peace and stability, and instead likely endanger the delicate status quo on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					Though the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (DPRK) has urged the two participants to cancel their annual saber rattling, the demand was apparently brushed off by Washington and Seoul without considering the consequences.
					
					It has been widely accepted within the international community that negotiations are the best possible way to denuclearize the peninsula and to install peace and stability not only between Pyongyang and Seoul, but also in northeastern Asia as a whole.
					
					The DPRK said recently it is ready to return to the multilateral dialogue with no preconditions attached and would implement the Sept. 19 joint statement on the principle of simultaneous action. 
					
					However, the no-precondition promise was lukewarmly received by either the United States or south Korea.
					
					A lack of trust and a wait-and-see attitude taken by the U.S. and south Korea have also complicated the peninsula's nuclear conundrum.
					
					China has for the past urged and remains unchanged that all related parties should exercise maximal restraint and do nothing to put regional peace and stability in jeopardy. 
					
					Therefore, the most urgent task for the U.S. and south Korea to do at the moment is not to trigger another round of tension in the region during their war games and fully consider the security concerns of the neighboring countries.
					
					They should also cease conducting any activities deemed to be provocative and aggressive to the DPRK in the future, and take serious steps together with other countries involved to denuclearize the divided peninsula.
					
					The United States and its ally need to remember that lasting peace could never be established through military coercion.

articles.title: China Marks Anti-Japanese War Victory Anniversary
articles.content:
China Marks Anti-Japanese War Victory Anniversary

					Beijing, August 17 (KCNA) -- Celebrations of the 66th anniversary of the Chinese people's victory in the anti-Japanese war took place in different parts of China.
					
					Over 100 people, including civic representatives and experts of the Nanjing International Peace Institute, met in Nanjing City on Monday to mourn the victims of the Nanjing Massacre and prayed for world peace.
					
					An estimated 100 000 local people and oversea Chinese compatriots visited the Memorial Hall of Anti-Japanese Jiangqiao Battle in Qiqihar City, Heilongjiang Province from Sunday to Monday.
					
					Earlier, a seminar marking the 80th anniversary of the Jiangqiao battle, groundbreaking ceremony of a patriotic education center and special symphony concert were held in the city.
					
					Such events were also held in Liaoning Province.

articles.title: Russia, China Discuss Cooperation in Space Field
articles.content:
Russia, China Discuss Cooperation in Space Field

					Moscow, August 17 (KCNA) -- Russia and China Tuesday held talks for cooperation in the space field.
					
					The two sides discussed a 2010-2012 plan for cooperation in the space field, establishment of a satellite telecommunications system for the Shanghai Cooperation Organization, joint research in long-distance space and cooperation in lunar study and manned space flight, said the Russian Federal Space General Bureau.

articles.title: Russia Builds New Satellite Launch Center
articles.content:
Russia Builds New Satellite Launch Center

					Moscow, August 17 (KCNA) -- Russia plans to construct a new satellite launch center in Vostochnii by 2015 and begin launching unmanned spacecraft.
					
					The Russian government will allot 251 billion Rbls and mobilize about ten thousand people for the project, a media report said.

articles.title: Economic Depression in Japan
articles.content:
Economic Depression in Japan

					Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- The number of condominiums put on sale in July in Tokyo and its vicinity dropped 1.3 percent from a year earlier, a private research agency said on August 11.
					
					The decrease is attributable to the drop of purchasing power of inhabitants caused by economic depression.
					
					Tokio Marine Holdings Inc. said its group net profit in the April to June quarter fell 2.2 percent from a year earlier.

articles.title: Eurozone Industrial Production Drops
articles.content:
Eurozone Industrial Production Drops

					Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- Industrial production decreased by 1.2 percent in June over the previous month, the European Union's (EU) statistics bureau Eurostat said on August 12.

articles.title: Casualties by Traffic Accidents in Australia
articles.content:
Casualties by Traffic Accidents in Australia

					Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- Causalities were caused by traffic accidents in Australia.
					
					The Bureau of Infrastructure, Transport and Regional Economics on August 15 said 1 291 people died in road crashes in the year to July 2011.

articles.title: Agricultural Production Up in Philippines
articles.content:
Agricultural Production Up in Philippines

					Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- Philippine agricultural growth in the first half rose 5.48 percent on year, said the minister of Agriculture on Monday.

articles.title: Natural Disasters in Cambodia, Philippines
articles.content:
Natural Disasters in Cambodia, Philippines

					Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- Lightning has killed at least 140 Cambodians and injured 101 others so far this year, said the government on August 13.
					
					Three people have been killed and over a hundred families fled their homes following flash floods and landslides that hit a southern Philippine town as of August 13.
					
					Fifteen homes were also destroyed and inhabitants of at least 100 households were evacuated to safe places.

articles.title: Mozambican President Visits China
articles.content:
Mozambican President Visits China

					Beijing, August 17 (KCNA) -- Mozambican President Armando Emilio Guebuza visited China from August 9 to 15.
					
					During the visit he held talks with Chinese President Hu Jintao and met and conversed with Wu Bangguo, chairman of the Standing Committee of the Chinese National People's Congress, and Wen Jiabao, premier of the State Council, respectively.
					
					Exchanged at the talks and conversations were views on the issue of developing the bilateral relations and other issues of mutual concern.
					
					A series of agreements were signed between the two countries during the visit.
					
					While staying in China, the Mozambican president toured Henan Province.

articles.title: Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region Works to Protect Beijing and Tianjin from Yellow Sand
articles.content:
Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region Works to Protect Beijing and Tianjin from Yellow Sand

					Beijing, August 17 (KCNA) -- The Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region, China is pushing forward the work to protect Beijing and Tianjin from yellow sand.
					
					The region has formed a green corridor, 400 km long and 1-10 km wide, in the area since 2000.
					
					It planted trees in the area covering 3 691 900 mu in the first half of the year, over 59 percent of the yearly quota for tree planting.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il envia mensaje de repuesta a Bashar al-Assad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il envia mensaje de repuesta a Bashar al-Assad

					Pyongyang, 18 de agosto (ACNC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio el dia 17 un mensaje de repuesta a Bashar al-Assad, secretario regional del Partido Socialista del Resurgimiento Arabe y presidente de la Republica Arabe de Siria.
					
					La misiva va como sigue:
					
					Expreso mi agradecimiento a Vd por haberme enviado un mensaje de consuelo en relacion con que algunas zonas de nuestro pais fueron danadas por las inundaciones.
					
					Aprovecho esta oportunidad para manifestarle mi conviccion de que se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran mas las excelentes relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre nuestros dos paises.

articles.title: Rinden homenaje a Kim Il Sung los visitantes a Corea
articles.content:
Rinden homenaje a Kim Il Sung los visitantes a Corea

					Pyongyang, 18 de agosto (ACNC) -- La delegacion del Ministerio de Defensa de Vietnam encabezada por su viceministro teniente general Nguyen Chi Vinh, la de los educadores de la Chongryon (Asociacion General de Coreanos Residentes en Japon) presidida por O Haeng Dok, jefe de seccion del Departamento de Educacion del Presidium del Comite Central de la misma entidad, y otros huespedes extranjeros y compatriotas en ultramar visitaron el dia 18 el Palacio Memorial Kumsusan para rendir homenaje al Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					
					Ellos dejaron manuscritos en el libro de visitas.
					
					El jefe de la delegacion vietnamita escribio que el Presidente Kim Il Sung y su homologo Ho Chi Minh prepararon las tradicionales relaciones de amistad entre ambos paises.
					
					Estoy convencido de que bajo la sabia direccion del Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea Kim Jong Il, el ejercito y el pueblo de Corea cumpliran la causa de construccion de la gran potencia prospera como lo deseaba el Presidente   Kim Il Sung, afirmo.

articles.title: CRPP denuncia ejercicios belicos "Ulji Freedom Guardian"
articles.content:
CRPP denuncia ejercicios belicos "Ulji Freedom Guardian"

					Pyongyang, 18 de agosto (ACNC) -- El portavoz del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria (CRPP) hizo publica el dia 17 una declaracion de condena a los ejercicios belicos conjuntos Estados Unidos-Sur de Corea "Ulji Freedom Guardian" que se desarrollan a partir del dia 16. 
					
					El texto completo va como sigue:
					
					Pese a nuestra fuerte advertencia y a la unanime denuncia de la opinion publica interna y externa, los imperialistas norteamericanos y los belicistas titeres surcoreanos iniciaron por fin los ejercicios militares conjuntos "Ulji Freedom Guardian". 
					
					En ese simulacro, que se librara en toda la extension surcoreana durante 11 dias desde el 16 hasta el 26, participaran 530 mil efectivos incluso mas de 30 mil efectivos norteamericanos estacionados en el Sur de Corea y en ultramar y las comandancias y unidades de todos los tipos de ejercito titere del Sur de Corea. 
					
					EE.UU. y el Sur de Corea introducen en el simulacro hasta el personal militar de varios paises que habia participado en la pasada guerra coreana, revelando asi abiertamente la intencion de provocar la segunda guerra coreana. 
					
					El CRPP denuncia severamente con vehemente indignacion el simulacro "Ulji Freedom Guardian", calificandolo de un grave desafio a toda la nacion coreana y la opinion publica interna y externa que aspiran a la paz de la Peninsula Coreana y de una provocacion nunca tolerable a la RPDC. 
					
					Lo que no se puede pasar por alto es que en el marco del presente simulacro los belicistas yanquis y surcoreanos realizaran los ejercicios de guerra especial contra la Direccion de la Revolucion de la RPDC y otros de ataque preventivo a las bases de armas nucleares y de misiles de esta. 
					
					Los titeres surcoreanos, insatisfechos con sus actos provocativos que denigran la dignidad suprema de la RPDC, tratan de aplicarlos junto con EE.UU. hasta en los ejercicios belicos de gran envergadura, lo cual provoca la indignacion y la hostilidad de nuestros militares y civiles. 
					
					Esto significa la declaracion de guerra total contra la RPDC.
					
					Con el inicio del presente simulacro EE.UU. y el Sur de Corea desenmascararon el velo de la paz y dialogo. 
					
					Ellos respondieron con los ejercicios de guerra  agresiva a los esfuerzos constantes de la RPDC por la paz, lo que muestra que ellos no tienen ningun interes en el dialogo y la mejora de las relaciones sino persiguen solamente la confrontacion y la guerra. 
					
					Los titeres surcoreanos son precisamente bribones y maniacos de guerra que por una parte preconizan la "era de paz y cooperacion" y por la otra, arman los alborotos belicos.  
					
					Al desplegar junto con su amo los ejercicios belicos anti-RPDC, el gobernante surcoreano convoca la reunion de seguridad, intensifica mas el estado de alerta del ejercito y practica los ejercicios de refugio de los civiles.
					
					Con el presente simulacro, se ha revelado mas claramente la naturaleza conflictiva y belicista de la banda de los titeres surcoreanos. 
					
					Ahora todo el mundo observa con sus propios ojos quien es el provocador en la Peninsula Coreana y quien es el perturbador de la paz y del dialogo. 
					
					Quien ama el peligro, en el perece. 
					
					Si los belicistas norteamericanos y surcoreanos desatan a toda costa la guerra de agresion, el ejercito y el pueblo de la RPDC aniquilaran completamente a los invasores y lograran el anhelo de la reunificacion de la patria. 
					
					EE.UU. y la banda titere surcoreana no deben burlarnos nunca mas. 
					
					El presente simulacro comprueba que es justa nuestra opcion y nos hace redoblar la decision de seguir manteniendola. 
					
					Nuestro ejercito y pueblo nunca toleraran los ejercicios belicos de caracter provocativo de los belicistas yanquis y surcoreanos, sino los aniquilaran sin piedad.

articles.title: Seul: mitin por la reunificacion independiente del 15 de agosto
articles.content:
Natural Disasters in Cambodia, Philippines

					Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- Lightning has killed at least 140 Cambodians and injured 101 others so far this year, said the government on August 13.
					
					Three people have been killed and over a hundred families fled their homes following flash floods and landslides that hit a southern Philippine town as of August 13.
					
					Fifteen homes were also destroyed and inhabitants of at least 100 households were evacuated to safe places.
